title.narrative: Protection for victims of confinement by non-state armed groups (NSAGs) in the Departments of Chocó, Antioquia and Valle del Cauca

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide protection to confined people by non-state armed groups and others at risk. This UNHCR project will 1) provide protection support to 3,372 children, 2) provide 20,800 mosquito nets, 5,400 solar lamps and 3,800 NFIs among other activities. The project provides life-saving assistance to 33,817 people, including 10,822 women, 10,483 men, 12,500 children, and 1,014 persons with disabilities.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS COLOMBIA RAPID RESPONSE VIOLENCE/CLASHES 2022

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: People affected by confinement and its host communities have access to registration, emergency protection mechanisms and lifesaving psychosocial support.
PP.1b Number of people accessing protection referral mechanisms and/or pathways.

Protection risks in the context of confinement are reduced through the distribution of emergency NFIs for vulnerable and at-risk persons, taking into account the specific needs and culture of the indigenous and afro-Colombian communities.
Number of mosquito nets distributed, complementing food items distributed by WFP.
Number of other NFIs distributed (hygiene kits, blankets, kitchen sets, jerry cans, vests, rubber boots, etc.)
Number of solar lamps distributed, complementing food items distributed by WFP

Vulnerable children, especially indigenous and afro-Colombian, affected by confinement benefit from community-based protection networks and safe space, thereby mitigating risks of forced recruitment and gender-based violence.
CP.3 – Number of children receiving protection support
